loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a special stand to display his fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Doña Eulalia con 54 años de edad es una mujer fuerte, con muchos sueños, muchas metas, esperanzas de que algún día sus cultivos de café sean los mejores y las más productivos de la zona. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora madre de 4 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos viven bajo su mismo techo y se involucran en las diferentes actividades del campo junto a su padre. Con ella también 4 nietos menores de edad y una nuera la cual ayuda con los diferente quehaceres en el hogar como limpieza, cocina, lavado entre otros. Ella en compañía de su familia se ha dedicado desde toda una vida a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café y hoy en día junto a su compañero de hogar no es la excepción siendo ellos agricultores. La tierra que ella en compañía de su familia trabaja en propia gracias al esfuerzo que han puesto por muchos años ubicada a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación y trasladándose a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento el cual ayudara a mantener su cosecha limpia de plagas, enfermedades entre otros comprando los diferentes insumos que ayudan a que esto sea posible. 

Sus planes son los de mejorar sus cosechas implementando un sistema de riego y manteniéndola sana, limpia y atractiva para sus clientes ya que de esa forma ella dejara a sus hijos un patrimonio fortalecido para poder enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 54, is a strong woman who has a lot of dreams and goals, who hopes that someday her coffee crops will be the best and most productive in the area.  She is a housewife, farmer and mother of 4.  Two of her children live under her roof, and are involved in the various activities in the field with their father.  She also has 4 grandchildren with her who are minors, and a daughter-in-law who helps her with the various household tasks such as cleaning, cooking, washing, among others.  Along with her family, Eulalia has devoted all of her life to farming, particularly the cultivation of coffee.  Now she continues to work in agriculture with her partner.  The land that she and her family work is their own, thanks to their efforts over many years.  It is located 2 kilometers from their house, and they walk there daily.

At this time, Eulalia is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to help her maintain her crops and keep them free of pests and diseases.  She will buy various farming supplies to help her make this possible. 

Eulalia's plans for the future include improving her harvests by installing an irrigation system and keeping her crops healthy, clean and attractive to her customers.  In this way, she will leave her children property that has been improved, so that they will be able to face future economic challenges in a favorable way.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, plant food, and other supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Nsene

texts.en:
Nsene operates a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

She appreciates the previous Kiva loan, which helped her to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and blessed with four children who are adults. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mwanakombo operates a clothes-selling business, selling women’s and men’s suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs. 50,000, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 22-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives in a rented house in the mining town of Chingola. She is engaged to be married this year and recently expanded her Zoona business after opening a new mobile money transfer shop in the nearby border town of Kasumbalesa.

This is Constance’s second loan; she used the money from her first loan to increase her working capital so that she could serve her customers who wanted to send larger amounts of money. She says the loan was very helpful in the growth of her business because she is now able to serve more customers who come to send and receive money from her Chingola outlet and no longer has to turn them away. Her earnings have also improved and she is excited about the growth of her business. She has even employed two more people to help her run the shops.

Constance is taking out another loan for her new shop in Kasumbalesa. The loan will be used as working capital float for her new outlet. Right now, the Kasumbalesa shop is working on a minimal working capital float of $1,000. This is not enough to satisfy the growing customer base in the thriving border town. The loan will help Constance grow her business.

In this picture, Constance (in the center) poses with her two employees.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can grow her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, su esposo de 80 años de edad, los cuales todos le ayudan en su actividad, ya que ella se dedica a la confección y venta de vestidos, dicho oficio lo realiza desde hace 20 años y lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: hilos, botones, zippers, telas entre otros gastos; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio  y realizar unos trámites personales.
Su sueño es adquirir un buen negocio para aportar a su familia y así brindarles  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her two children who are 12 and 15 years old and her husband who is 80 years old. They all help out with her business as she makes a living in dressmaking and sales. She has had this occupation for 20 years and she works at it every day. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy basic materials like thread, buttons, zippers, fabric and to pay for other expenses. This investment will help her to strengthen the business as well as allow her to carry out some personal things. 

Her dream is to have a good business that will support her family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, zippers, fabric, and to cover other expenses.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, now 29 years old, has been running his Zoona money transfer business for three years. He got his first Kiva loan last year and has fully repaid it. The loan helped Paul to grow his business. He was able to serve more customers and make enough commissions from his first shop to open another mobile money transfers shop in his hometown of Kabwe. Today, Paul now has three employees.

Paul is requesting a second loan so that he can open a third mobile money transfer outlet in his hometown and continue to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business. He says the Kiva loan will help him satisfy the demand from his customers. Paul is the only Zoona mobile money agent in Kabwe and this puts pressure on him to always have money to serve customers. He would like to open a third shop to meet the growing demand and reduce some of the congestion that has accumulated at his two other shops. Paul will use his Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth, hire two more people, purchase two phones and add to his working capital.

Paul would like to thank his Kiva lenders for their assistance. As a young micro-entropreneur in Zambia, he says working capital finance is very difficult to find and therefore, he has appreciated the opportunity to be linked to Kiva lenders. He is now renting a better house closer to his town where his businesses are located.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business by opening a new outlet in his hometown of Kabwe.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a divorced man with three kids who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a motorcycle business for the past four years. His potential clients are mostly his fellow neighbors and villagers. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase an extra motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase an extra motorcycle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking single mother of two girls. She has been running her mobile money transfers business for nearly four years and now has two outlets in Solwezi. She is requesting a second Kiva loan so that she can continue to grow her business. 

Even though Angela has enjoyed some success, securing working capital for her business still remains a significant challenge since she does not have the collateral required for a bank loan.  It is for this reason that Angela has requested another Kiva loan. 

Angela is hopeful that once the Kiva loan comes in, the additional working capital will enable her to serve more customers in the busy mining town of Solwezi. Given the high demand to send and receive money, Angela knows that increasing her float is the key to growing her profits and improving her family's well being. 

Angela would like to take this opportunity to thank her Kiva lenders. With her first loan, she was able to purchase a trading booth and renovate it so that her customers could have some shelter as they transact. With the increased earnings from her first shop, she was also able to bring her children to live with her in Solwezi, and they are now in school.

loans.use: to increase her working capital (cash float for electronic transfers) so that she can grow her business.

loans.name: Soriba

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Soriba. He is single and has no children. He has no additional dependents. 

In 2007, Soriba established his jeans business after he left school. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 550,000 as profit every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy his goods direct from the importer at a reduced rate. Soriba is expecting to increase his profit by Le 400,000. His major challenge is the fluctuation of the dollar against the Leone. He has almost succeeded in the contract of supplying goods to his customers. 

Soriba thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans for his business.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married father of two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills. 

He operates a private school business, and his customers are his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of renovation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a shop business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 that he is requesting, Suleiman wants to purchase more desks and textbooks for the children. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and textbooks for the children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs of maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling to her neighbors, who use the charcoal for cooking. She mentioned that lack of enough capital to expand her business has been the major problem.

With the Kshs 40,000, Meali wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: Doña Karla, una señora trabajadora que ha cumplido con darles de crecer  a sus hijos hoy en día son independientes y casados los seis lo cual para ella es una gran alegría, ahora ella solamente trabaja para cubrir sus gastos junto a su esposo. Karla continua con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanías productos de adornos para el hogar elaborados a base de barro, artesanía Nicaragüense los cuales compra y vende. Ella solicita el crédito para continuar invirtiendo en estos productos variados, siendo esta su única manera de ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Karla is a hard-working woman. She has seen to it that her six children have grown and are now independent and married, which is a source of great happiness for her. Now, she only works to cover her expenses together with her husband. Karla continues with her small business selling decorative crafts made from clay, Nicaraguan crafts which she buys and sells. 

She is seeking this loan in order to keep investing in these varied products, since this is her only way to make a living.

loans.use: to buy varied craft products.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti has operated a charcoal selling business, selling to her neighbors who use it for cooking.   She mentioned that lack of enough capital to expand her business has been the major problem in the business.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu has been operating a tailoring business making school uniforms and suits for both men and women. Her challenge in the business is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a rental house in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, sewing thread and needles for the business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is single and has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For the past two years she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kes. 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees for her family. 

She sells fish from home to the general public to earn a living. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kes. 20,000 she wants to purchase more fish for sale for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale for her business.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 43 años, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Lupe  se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas que compra en el puerto de su ciudad.  La venta la en un triciclo acondicionado con un parlante para ofertar su producto,  lo usa de transporte, para llevar sus productos por las calles. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila a un chofer,  generándose un ingreso adicional. Se inicio hace más de 03 años con este negocio, contando con un capital propio y luego fue aumentando con préstamos, contando con el apoyo de su conviviente en la venta. Empezó este negocio para tener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los estudios de sus hijos, logrando educarlos siendo esa la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar. Por tanto,  viendo sus buenos resultados, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerse.Por  tanto éste será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, esta muy agradecido de tener la oportunidad de continuar con su negocio. Con el monto de S./ 1000, los invertirá en la reparación de su mototaxi .
texts.en: Lupe is forty-three and married and lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She makes a living selling fresh fish in the morning that she buys from the port in her city.  She makes her sales on a tricycle that is equipped with a loudspeaker so she can offer her product.  She uses the tricycle as transportation to carry her product through the streets.  She also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents out to a driver, which generates additional income.  She started this business more than three years ago with her own capital and later expanded it with loans.  She also has the support of her husband with making sales.  She started her business to have the necessary income to cover the costs of her children's education.  Giving them an education is the best inheritance that she can give them.  Since she has seen good results, she hopes to continue with her business and support herself.  This will be her second loan with Kiva.  She is very thankful to have the opportunity to continue with her business.  She will invest the 1,000 PEN in repairing her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle taxi so she can rent it out and increase her income.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Malak is a 25-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarm city. She and her husband live in an old house, which is not very comfortable. They would like to complete their new home and live in it as soon as possible. Malak's husband works as a construction worker. This is the only source of income to the family. It is low because it is seasonal. Construction work increases in the summer.

Malak took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Malak to complete building the family's new home by buying stones and cement. This will allow Malak, her husband, and future kids to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her new home.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelia hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and from there she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She is also into a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will have a good life and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for herbal medicines and food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad, de 51 años de edad, es divorciada y vive en compañía de su hijo en la casa de sus padres. Natividad se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, por está razón abrió una tienda en el interior de su vivienda.  Decidió iniciar éste negocio  hace más de 06  años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y ampliar su negocio. Tiene clientes, contando en su mayoría de vecinos, a quienes atiende con la ayuda de su madre. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite socializarse con sus vecinos y tener más amistades con quienes conversar. Gracias a los ingresos económicos puede solventar los gastos necesarios de su hogar. Este es su séptimo préstamo con Kiva y se siente contenta de recibir el apoyo necesario para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, para surtir y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Natividad is 51 years old. She is divorced and lives with her child in her parents’ house. Natividad works selling food products; for this reason, she opened a store inside her home. 

She decided to start this business more than 6 years ago, which was time that she used to grow and expand her business. She has customers among the majority of her neighbors, who she serves with the help of her mother. She likes her work because it allows her to socialize with her neighbors and have more friends who she can talk with.  

Thanks to the income, she is able to pay for her necessary household expenses. This is her seventh loan with Kiva, and she feels pleased to receive the help she needs in order to continue moving forward. In addition, she is committed to paying off her quotas punctually.

With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase food products such as rice, sugar and milk, among others, in order to restock and increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel,  está casado y disfruta de cuatros hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 28, 30, 32 y 35 años. El, se dedica a la cultivo de maíz, asimismo siembra hortalizas tales como: jícamas, tomates, chiles, actividad que la realiza desde hace 45 años y oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres, lo desempeña todos los días de 6: 00am a 3:00pm, hasta la fecha no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios tales como: herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, abono, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener los insumos agrícolas requeridos para la siembra del cultivo.
Su sueño es apoyar a su familia con la alimentación y continuar cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Gabriel is married and has four children, who are ages 28, 30, 32, and 35 years. He works cultivating corn. He also farms vegetables such as jícama, tomatoes, and chilies. He has been doing this work for 45 years; he learned it from his parents. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. So far, this hasn’t given him any difficulties. 

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy necessary agricultural materials, such as herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, pest controls, and fertilizer, among others; this investment will help him to have the necessary farming supplies to harvest the crops. 

His dream is to support his family with the food and continue cultivating the land.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, pest controls, and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old, married and has two children. 

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Laizamon

texts.es:
Laizamón tiene 61 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Laizamón se dedica a la fabricación de mesas, sillas o cualquier otro mueble de madera y la construcción de casas, es muy reconocido en su sector por la calidad y la rapidez con que ejecuta sus obras. Lleva en éste trabajo más de 26 años, le gusta mucho crear viviendas o muebles que se vean hermosas. 
Aunque reconoce que su trabajo le ha permitido conseguir el dinero necesario para solventar sus gastos familiares, siente que los años de intensa actividad están produciéndole cansancio, es por eso que desea ayudar con más frecuencia a su esposa en su puesto de venta de vegetales. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 03 con Kiva, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará algunos herramientas de uso común en su trabajo y para arreglar el puesto de venta de vegetales de su esposa.
texts.en:
Laizamón is 61 years old, married, and lives in his own house with his wife and 4 children. Laizamón builds houses and constructs tables, chairs, and other wooden furnishings. He is recognized in his neighborhood for the quality and speed with which he executes his work. He has over 26 years of work experience, and very much likes building houses and furniture that look beautiful.
Although he realizes that his work has permitted him to get the necessary money to cover his family's expenses, he feels that the years of intense activity are causing him fatigue. For this reason he wants to help his wife in her post selling vegetables more often. Therefore this will be his third loan with Kiva, and he is very happy to receive the financial support that he has been receiving as well as to move forward with his business. With the solicited amount of 1000 soles he will buy some tools for regular use in his job and to fix the vegetable selling post of his wife.

loans.use: to buy tools to use in his construction business

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is 62 years old and married with 6 children.

Purification works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Purification has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

Purification aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
This is Beverly. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store which resulted in a higher income. It also helped in the education of her children as well as in their household expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Beverly hopes to be more successful and have more sources of income. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 71 years old and married with ten children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio 44 años de edad casado con un hijo menor de edad aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por el comercio, Manuel se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa de niños, cosméticos, medina natural, prendas zapatos, entre otros según temporadas en que se esté, el objetivo de este crédito es para realizar mejoras en su propiedad que es construir un cuarto de bloques, debido a que su casa esta forrada de zin en su totalidad, anteriormente su vivienda era de madera pero estaba a punto de caer por que decide improvisadamente hacerla de zin, pero ahora Manuel cuenta que uno de sus sueños es poder reemplazar el zin por bloques que es más seguro para su familia, no es primer crédito que el este solicitando en los créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en la forma de pago, el financiamiento que está solicitando es para compra de materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, cal, arena, clavos, Perlines, entre otros.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio, 44, is married and has a minor child in his care.  He is from the town of Chinandega, an area known for its commerce.  Manuel sells general goods such as children's clothing, cosmetics, natural medicine, clothing, shoes, etc., depending on the season.  The loan he is requesting is to renovate his home by building brick walls because the entire house is lined in metal sheeting.  Before, his house was made of wood but was about to collapse so he decided to improvise using zinc.

Now Manuel wants to replace the zinc with bricks for his family's safety.  This is not his first loan and he has a good repayment record on previous ones.  The loan will be used to buy construction materialsl such as bricks, cement, lime, sand, nails, beams, etc.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, lime, sand, iron, etc.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José, se le presenta  la necesidad de invertir más en el oficio de la agricultura, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual le servirá para comprar cerdos  y reparación de galera para proteger los cerdos.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro incrementar su capital de trabajo y obtuvo mayores ingresos; las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs to invest more in his farming activity and is requesting a new loan.  He will use it to buy pigs and to repair their pen.

The previos loan proved to be very helpful because he was able to increase his working capital and obtain more income.  His family circumstances are the same and his economic situation has improved.

loans.use: To buy pigs and repair the pig pen.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Presencia Group

texts.es:
DÚO SOLIDARIO PRESENCIA
la señora María Antonieta de 49 años de edad quien tiene una venta de variedades para toda ocasión ubicada en la calle principal San Franciso 2, de Aldea Vista Hermosa. Ella quien está a lado de sus hijos está muy contenta porque la apoyan en todo, Su venta es muy visitada por las muchachas que trabajan en la fábrica de ahí cerca, pero le hacen falta varias cosas,  necesita hacer pedidos más grandes en los catálogos para tener las cremas, lociones, desodorantes, discos, regalos para toda ocasión y la cual el dinero no le alanza para ofrecer lo que sus clientes le están pidiendo. Necesita entonces un capital para poder comprar lo que le hace falta y así no quedarles mal a sus compradoras que la mayoría son muchachas, espera que le puedan ayudar ya que de esta forma ella sueña poco a poco salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
DÚO SOLIDARIO PRESENCIA GROUP

María Antonieta, 49, runs a general store located on the main street, San Francisco 2, in the village of Vista Hermosa.  She is very content to have the support of her children who help her in everything.  Her store stays very busy with visits by the girls who work at the nearby factory, but she is in need of many things.

She must order larger quantities by catalogue of creams, lotions, deodorants, cotton discs, and gifts for all occasions but does not have enough money to buy what her customers are asking for.  Therefore, she needs the capital to buy the items she needs so as not to disappoint her customers, most of which are girls.  She hopes you can help her to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, deodorants, cotton discs, and gifts for all occasions.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 32 años, está  casada y vive en la casa de sus padres junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Karina se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas,  le encanta cocinar es por eso que no duda en preparar y poner a la venta todos los días los platos más deliciosos de su región, acompaña sus platos con las bebidas más refrescantes elaboradas de las mejores frutas de la zona. Desde que se inició hace 3 años en esta actividad siempre ha trabajado sola. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante, aunque tiene experiencia, todavía es un poco estresante cuando se encuentre con muchos clientes, pero espera tener su restaurante  fijo algún día para atenderles mejor. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de S./ 1000 comprará que necesita para continuar preparando sus comida y también comprar unas mesas y sillas para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karina, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in her parent's home.  She sells regional foods which she loves to cook; so every day she prepares and sells the most delicious regional dishes and most refreshing drinks made with the best fruit in the area.

Karina has been in business, alone, for three years  In the future she would like to have a restaurant.  Although she has experience, it is still a little stressful when she has many customers.  But she hopes to have a permanent restaurant in the future to provide better customer service.

This is her third Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support which will allow her to consolidate her plans.  She will use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy what she needs to continue making food, as well as tables and chairs for her customers.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients, and tables and chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Tiessiriton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes de Tiessiriton 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 24 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankoroniwere. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Yah (deuxième  femme debout à droite dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Banankoroniwere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The six women from the Tiessiriton 2 group are all married into traditional families. They average 24 years of age with three children. They all live in the village of Banankoroniwere, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They became acquainted through their rainy season agricultural activities, neighborhood ties, marriage and kinship in the village.

They cultivate groundnuts, millet and rice. To purchase small equipment, and supplies of agricultural inputs, the group heard about Soro Yiriwaso and are in their first seasonal loan cycle.

Mrs. Yah (the second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Banankoroniwere. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay youths to weed her field.

The sale of agricultural products is made ​​in cash at the end of the rainy season. It will serve to pay off her loan and have some income to take care of the children, and part of the family.

loans.use: To purchase small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Luisa Iveth

texts.es:
Luisa,  requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio que posee; este le servirá para comprar bolsas plásticas y artículos de primera necesidad.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener mayores ingresos e incrementar sus inventarios;  las condiciones económicas han mejorado, mientras que las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Luisa needs a new loan to use as work capital so she can continue investing in her business.  This will allow her to buy plastic bags and essential items.

The previous loan helped her increase her stock and income.  Her economic conditions have improved and her family situation remains the same.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags and essential items.

loans.name: Tiessiriton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes de Tiessiriton 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 2enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankoroniwere. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Maratou (deuxième  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Banankoroniwere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The five women from the Tiessiriton 3 group are all married into traditional families. They average 27 years of age with two children. They all live in the village of Banankoroniwere, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They became acquainted through their rainy season agricultural activities, neighborhood ties, marriage and kinship in the village.

They cultivate groundnuts, millet and rice. To purchase small equipment, and supplies of agricultural inputs, the group heard about Soro Yiriwaso and are in their first seasonal loan cycle.

Mrs. Maratou (the second woman standing from the left in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Banankoroniwere. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay youths to weed her field.

The sale of her agricultural products is made ​​in cash at the end of the rainy season. It will serve to pay off her loan and have some income to take care of the children, and part of the family.

loans.use: buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Amerita

texts.en:
Amerita is a 42-year-old married woman from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She has six children.The oldest child is 20 while the youngest is five. She is engaged in tailoring services. She provides services like dress-making and dress-adjustment to customers in the community. Aside from tailoring services, Amerita also engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been into tailoring services for more than 10 years. 

Amerita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy cloth, thread and fertilizers. In the future, Amerita would like to expand both her businesses to support her family and also to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional stock of supplies and products like towels, curtains and bed sheets needed in her business.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, age 39, is a married mother of four children, all of them are still in school and dependent on her. To strive for a living, she has been feeding pigs and distilling alcohol which are the main sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in this business in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province for 10 years. 

Sophal has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans and now she feels confident to take a new loan. Now she is leading a group of two members to apply for a loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion in order to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes to earn a larger income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager in Battambang province, Hoy is 46 years old and she is a farmer who grows rice to make a living. She has seven children, one of whom is still in school. From the current business, which she has been doing for 27 years, she is able to earn about 31,900 KHR per day. 

She has been in this business for four loan cycles. She has fully repaid back her loans and she feels confident that she can improve her living conditions. Now she is leading a group of four to request a new loan. 

As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for growing rice and will also use a portion of it on buying gasoline for plowing the field. She hopes that she can get high crop yield from farming so as to have better living conditions than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Fely has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 64 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 40 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 45 years old and married with seven children.

Analie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from meat-vending.

Analie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, 51 years of age, is a dynamic and hard-working farmer. He has been in his business for almost 23 years. He is married to a store keeper who helps him in earning some income for their family. They are earning more or less PHP 10,000 a month which is a great help for their daily expenditures and the school allowances of their children. 

To create and achieve higher yields, Armando is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his agricultural business. He's looking forward to a progressive and profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lourdes hopes that her business will prosper. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups which meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 38 years old, is married and a mother of three children living in Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a driver and she helps him by planting vegetables to sell to earn a living. 

She requested a loan from GDMPC to be used to prepare the land and seed a new plot in her vegetable garden. She hopes to have an abundant  harvest to gain more income for a better future of the family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and seed a new plot in her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 57 and a widow, living in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She manages her own farm where she grows bananas and coconuts to earn a living. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro-credit in order to cover the costs of banana-replanting so as to allow for expansion of her farm. She plans to cultivate the farm to generate additional harvest to gain income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of banana-replanting.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Hassani est leader du collectif de crédit  « Upendo», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 67 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants étudient  et d’autres ont déjà leurs familles respectives. Son conjoint est un technicien en métallurgie (ajusteur). La cliente est couturière.  Elle est propriétaire d’un atelier de coupe et couture.  Elle commença son atelier avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari vers les années 1983. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les materiels de couture (tissus, fils, tirettes, mordoré, dentelles, etc.).  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses petits fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Member Hassani is leader of the  Upendo credit loan solidarity group. An experienced entrepreneur, 67 years of age. she is married with six children of whom some are in school and others already have their own families. Her husband is an technician in metallurgy (fitter).

This member is a seamstress. She owns a tailoring and sewing workshop. She started her workshop with her own funds received from her husband around 1983.

This new loan will be used to buy sewing material (fabric, thread, zippers, bronze ribbons, lace, etc..). She wants to expand her business, educate her children, feed her grandchildren. To summarize, she strongly thanks Hekima for its support with the microfinancing of small businesses.

loans.use: buy sewing material (fabric, thread, zippers, bronze ribbons, lace, etc.).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Rokia, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the  Benkadi I group are married women who on average are 53 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are in their fourth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The featured member is Rokia, who cultivates rice, and is seen standing second from the right in the photo.
With her ​​loan, she intends to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment and pay the labor to maintain one hectare (2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop will be sold at the village market, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She expects to make a profit of 85,000 FCFA by the end of the season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for tillage, seeds, agricultural inputs, farm machinery and the cost of weeding.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is three. She engages in fishing. She sells fish. She has been involved in fishing for more than 10 years. Her husband works as a carpenter. His income is not enough to support her family.

Angelita requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, paint and epoxy (a type of resin) to improve her fishing activity. In the future, Angelita would like to expand her fishing business to support her family with good food and provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, paint and epoxy.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James manages a general store in Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental where his family lives. He is 56 years old with one son. He has been selling groceries in the local community to earn a living for more than five years. He also earns from his motor transportation services. 

Recently, he took a loan  from GDMPC micro credit to purchase stock like canned goods, bottled products, sachet products and noodles. He hopes to gain additional profit so as to have a better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock like canned goods, bottled products, sachet products and noodles.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him by operating the motor transportation and rental business that they own for a living. 

She took a loan from GDMPC  in order to cover the costs of motor maintenance so as to give better services. She plans to save a portion of her profit to buy another motorcycle so as to expand the business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor maintenance so as to give better services.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her children's education and their household expenditures. She has been in this business for twenty years and she keeps on working to provide a good future for her family.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy dried fish she needs in her business. The more dried fish displayed on her stall the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Hilda hopes to continuously be successful in her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec KADIA, 3 ème assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi II group are married women who on average are 47 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are in their fourth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The featured member is Kadia, who cultivates rice, and is seen sitting third from the right in the photo. She intends to use her ​​loan to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment and pay the labor costs to maintain one hectare (2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop will be sold in the village and at the Koutiala market, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She expects to make a profit of 105,000 FCFA by the end of the season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for seeds, agricultural inputs, farm machinery and the costs of tillage and weeding.

loans.name: Sonnyboy

texts.en:
Sonnyboy is 35 years old and married but has no children yet. He lives in a wooden house that he bought five years ago. 

Sonnyboy has been farming for almost eight years. To have adequate help in the fields, he hires local laborers who do excellent work on his farmland. 

In the future, he’d like to become a buyer of agricultural products because he’ll be able to earn higher profits and insure a better future for his family. He's asking for a loan of Php 15,000 to buy organic manure for his agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie lives in Sumasap, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her children. For five years, she has run a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living.

She took a loan to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles and spices. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles and spices.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia is raising fish and crabs in her fishpond at Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanag del Sur, for a living. Aside from doing this, she also runs a store selling goods in the community. She took a loan from GDMPC to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and biscuits. She hopes to gain more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 46, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Mario, her business partner, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Emily oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have two tricycles that carry up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle drivers then remit a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. They also have one pedicab and an apartment for additional income She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their tricycles.

Emily hopes to have more tricycles and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha can prove that her loan got her a long way in her business. Aside from her food stall, she also has a salon, a Selecta stall and a catering service. The loans that she acquired were also a big help in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha hopes that all her businesses will continue to grow and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her food stall business.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 59-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in fishing. She and her husband work hard to earn a living. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years now. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing nets and to have additional capital to survive her fishing activity. 

In the future, Bibiana would like to expand her fishing business and to set aside some of the profits to buy a new pump boat, which would be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia runs her general store selling goods in the community of Cabgan, Tambulig where she lives with her family. She has been doing this for many years to earn a living. 

Recently, she took a loan in order to buy additional canned goods, rice and biscuits to sell. She hopes to improve her offering to gain more profit and be able to save a portion for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 55-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 23 while the youngest is 11. She is engaged in fishing. She has been involved in fishing for more than 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy a fishing net and a pump for her boat. In the future, Catalina would like to improve her fishing business to provide her children with proper diets and quality education as well.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a pump for her boat.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee, 32 years old, is single. She resides in San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Haidee owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She earns PHP 7,000 monthly from this business. 

Haidee has requested a new loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay the costs of farm maintenance. In 2009, Haidee joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay the costs of farm maintenance.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Guadioso

texts.en:
Guadioso, a 51 year old married man and a father of five, has operated his service-based business in Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur for many years. GDMPC helped him to improve and become an entrepreneur. 

Recently he took a loan of 20,000 PHP in order to buy a new set of tires. He hopes to expand his business to gain more income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
This is Benita. She previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP to buy more products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benita hopes that her business will get bigger and dreams of helping her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
This is Delsa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different products like clothes, slippers, shorts, towels, bed sheets and other products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of clothes, slippers, shorts, towels, bed sheets and other products for her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delsa hopes for a continuous growth in her business and dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy clothes, slippers, shorts, towels, bed sheets and other products for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 38 years-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for ten years now. Her husband is a fisherman and Alma sells his catch as a source of livelihood. She is also engaged in selling coconut wine and soft drinks. Her business is financially insufficient to sustain itself. 

Alma requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like a fish net, hooks and gasoline for the motorboat. In the future, Alma would like to invest in another business to gain more profit, and at the same time, save for old age.

loans.use: to buy a  fishnet, hooks and gasoline for the motorboat.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has managed her piggery for many years, raising pigs for sale. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del with her family. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy piglets to raise and sell in the future. She hopes she will be able to expand her piggery in the near future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur has operated his farm for many years. Aside from this, he also provides motor transportation during his free time to earn more income. Recently, he borrowed an amount of 50,000.00 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure and to cover the costs of farm maintenance. He hopes to gain an abundant harvest to have a better income in the near future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer such as manure and to cover the costs of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, is married and a mother of four. She manages a transportation business to earn a living. Recently, she requested a loan from GDMPC micro-credit in order to buy a new set of tires to provide better service. With her current business and the help of GDMPC, she hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires to provide better service.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a 65-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 7 grown children. She is engaged in farming, growing rice. She has been growing rice for almost 15 years. Her husband is also a farmer and helps her work their farm.

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides to gain more harvest, and to pay a laborer's fee. Aurelia would like to expand her rice farming business to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 41-year-old woman who has had a fishing business for 21 years. She is from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with eight children between the ages of 4 and 19. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a fish net and pay for motorboat maintenance. She hopes to have enough earnings so she can continue supporting her children's education. 

In the future, she plans to make her business bigger so she can obtain a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and pay for motorboat maintenance .

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya tiene 19 años, es soletera, y vive en su casa propia junto a su madre. Cinthya es costura, cose ropas de diferentes variedades para todo tipo de ocasión, lo cual lo realiza en su casa  propia. Se inició con esta actividad gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, aprendió e invirtió su capital comprando máquinas de costura y materiales  para empezar con esa actividad. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 03 años, tiempo que le  sirvió para hacerse conocida por la calidad de su costura, y cada día aumenta el número de clientes. 
Considera rentable a esta actividad ya que puede ayudar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar.
Espera seguir creciendo y ampliar más su negocio y convertirse en una empresaria de costura. Esta será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, blondas entre otras.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 19 years old. She is single and lives at home with her mother. 

Cinthya is a seamstress, making different types of clothing for all occasions, which she does in her own home. She began this activity because she studied at an occupational education center, learning and investing capital buying sewing machines and supplies to begin that activity.

She has been doing this work for more than three years and during this time has become known for the quality of her sewing and each day the number of her customers grow. She considers the work to be profitable as she can help her mother with the household expenses. She hopes to continue growing and expanding her business and to become a tailoring entrepreneur.

This will be her second loan through Kiva. She is very happy to be able to have the financial support that she has been receiving so she can go forward with her business and become a great entrepreneur. With the requested loan of 1200 soles she will buy sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, lace, and other items.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en: Eustaquia is a widow and has four adult children. She sells magazines and foods like "tagactac", a local delicacy and a specialty of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She lives with her grandchildren who help her in her business of selling food in the bus terminal to earn a living. She borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy raw ingredients and goods to sell. She plans to save a portion of her profit to prepare for future needs.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and goods to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca, vive en casa propia con su familia, su madre y disfruta de tres hijos. Ella, se dedica a  la elaboración de pupusas y venta de merienda,  oficio que lo realiza para apoyar a su familia  y lo desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo atrás. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, condimentos, entre otros y asimismo una mesa con sillas para atender mejor a los clientes y estos se sientan satisfechos.
Su sueño es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educación a sus hijos, asimismo crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in her own home with her family, her mother and the enjoyment of her three children. 

She works making pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and selling snacks, work that helps her support her family and that she has been doing for a long time.

The loan she is seeking will allow her to buy prime supplies such as cheese, chicharrones (pork cracklings), oil, condiments, and other items and also a table with chairs in order to better serve her customers so they feel content.

Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life and education to her children while expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese, chicharrones, oil, condiments, and other items as well as a table with chairs

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Amanecer De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Solidario Amanecer de San Bartolo
Doña Angélica Yolanda, ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene dos hijas a su cargo una de 5 y la pequeña de 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, así como ropa de bebe, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio, en especial inversión de compra de cosméticos y blusas para dama, su propósito es seguir surtiendo su negocio que lo tiene en san Mateo Milpas Altas, su deseo es darle lo mejor a sus hijas y apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos de la casa, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado,ya que de esta forma ella podra realizar su sueño que ha tenido en mucho tiempo que es agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en: Angélica Yolanda is 24 years old and has two children aged 5 and 2. She makes a living selling cosmetics, blouses, skirts, trousers, and baby clothes. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business, buying cosmetics and women's' blouses. Her intention is to continue stocking her store in San Mateo Milpas Altas, and her wish is to give her children the best and support her husband with household expenses. She hopes you can help her with the loan, since in this way, she will be able to achieve her long-running dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children in Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Aside from fishing, she also has had a store selling goods in their village. She would like to borrow a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fingerlings to raise. 

She hopes to harvest abundantly to gain income for the better future of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings to raise.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando,  se le presenta la necesidad  de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; este le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas,  plaguicidas, entre otros.  
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y asimismo para sus estudios; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Orlando is in need of a new loan because he needs more working capital. This will allow him to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, among others.

His previous loan was advantageous, helping him strengthen the business and also for his studies, improving the financial situation, and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, among others

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es: El señor Jairo habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, el labora para una negocio privada y su esposa es comerciante vende cosmeticos, entre los dos se dividen los  gastos del hogar, actualmente el necesita realizar unas modificaciones en su casa ya que con las lluvias se les pasa el agua ya que el techo esta deteriorado, y quiere que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida, con el credito comprara: Zinc, perlines, Cemento, Arena, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
