He is a member of the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata," and at this time he needs a loan to pay the wages of workers who he hires to work on his land.  He appreciates and values this loan, and is committed to making all of his monthly payments in a very responsible way. (The city of Challabamba is located in the Challabamba district of the province of Paucartambo, in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to pay the wages of workers who work in his fields

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La Señora Maria continua dedicandose a la venta de comestibles ,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de aceite y arroz para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "Clorinda Matto de Turner" communal bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association.

Maria is still working in cosmetics sales, which she has done for years. The business is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She is a responsible person. She wants to keep working so she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil and rice for her business. Maria is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and rice for her business

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es: Evelia ha tenido una situación muy difícil pues hace algunos años su esposo murió y ella se quedó a cargo de sus tres hijos. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan en la producción del café y gracias al crédito de Kiva durante la cosecha pasada pudieron comprar fertilizantes para sus fincas de café y lograron aumentar su producción. Para esta cosecha Evelia necesita otro financiamiento de Kiva ya que comprará más fertilizante y resembrará parte de su finca para que en unos años su producción pueda aumentar aún más.
texts.en:
Evelia has endured a very difficult situation: some years ago her husband died and she was left in charge of their 3 children. Her oldest children now help her in the production of coffee and thanks to a Kiva loan during the past harvest season, Evelia was able to purchase fertilizers for her coffee fields, and she managed to expand her production. 

For this harvest, Evelia needs another loan from Kiva. She wishes to purchase added fertilizers and to re-sow part of her coffee farm anew. Thus, in a few years, her production can be increased even more.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and re-sow a part of her coffee farm.

loans.name: Lissi

texts.es:
Lissi es de la ciudad de Ybycui, cuenta es que es hija de padres separados, que ha tenido que luchar mucho para estudiar y el día de mañana ser una profesional. Poco a poco y por medio de la ayuda de su madre ha ido creciendo.
Tiene muchas metas pero por la principal que lucha es poder ser una profesional útil que sirva no solo a su familia sino también a su comunidad.  Ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, y solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en los gastos de titulación de la universidad, ya que las gestiones son muy caras y está necesitando.
texts.en:
Lissi is from the city of Ybycui.

Her parents are separated and she has had to fight hard to study so that  in the future she can be a professional. 

Little by little thanks to the help of her mother she has kept moving forward. 

She has many goals but the main one is to keep fighting to become a useful professional who not only helps her family but also her community. 

She is studying nutrition and is requesting a loan to pay for the university degree fee since the administration costs are very expensive but necessary.

loans.use: to pay for the university degree fee.

loans.name: Abrahn

texts.es:
El socio Abrahan se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza transporte urbano en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Calca,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su mototaxi.

El socio esta contento con el credito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Abrahn is still working in the transportation business. He works in urban transportation on the different streets of Calca. He works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. Abrahn has had this business for six years and it is going very well. His dream is to have a car. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his motor taxi.

Abrahn is happy with the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motor taxi

loans.name: Maria Agnes

texts.en:
Maria Agnes is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and the mother of two children.  She operates a general store selling goods in the community to earn a living. She has been doing this business for many years, and she needs to add stock to diversify. 

She wants a loan from GDMPC to buy rice, feeds and corn grits to sell. 

She planned to renovate her store to make business comfortably and gain more costumers.

loans.use: to buy rice, feeds and corn grits

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 56 years old and married; she has one child who stays with her in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for years, and earns 7,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she had requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase rice and feeds to sell. 

In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and feeds to sell.

loans.name: Yrami Ines

texts.es:
La socia Yrami se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,galletas y aceite.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en:
Yrami continues with her business of selling basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She has a grocery store where she sells from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She has had this business for six years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and cooking oil.  She is happy with the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 58 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos; pero solo vive con dos de ellos. Durante tota su vida, ella se ha dedicado a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. 

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora; se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana todos los días para dirigirse a su trabajo, que consiste en cuidar una casa, para llegar a su destino camina media hora el la mañana y media hora en la tarde luego viene a realizar los oficios de la casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar su casa; debido a que esta en mal estado y desea  arreglarla ya que en la época lluviosa todo se moja al igual que las paredes se debilitan por lo que quiere comprar tejas para reforzar el techo y cemento para reforzar las paredes.

Reparando su casa, ya no tendrá que preocuparse por que las camas se le mojan o porque se le mete el agua por las paredes, ella podrá dormir tranquila al igual que cuando este trabajando no estar pensando que pueda  pasar  en su casa cuando este lloviendo.

Su objetivo es,  seguir trabajando y poco a poco seguir reparando su casa hasta dejarla en muy buenas condiciones para que sus hijos puedan estar muy cómodos en  ella.
texts.en:
Milagro, 58 years old, is divorced and has three children. However, she only lives with two of them. All her life, she has worked in the home, taking care of domestic tasks.

She is a hard-working woman. She gets up at 4:00am every day to begin her work, which consists of taking care of one house. To get to her destination, she walks half an hour in the morning and half an hour in the afternoon. Then she comes to complete the housework.

The loan she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to repair her house because it is in bad shape and she wants to fix it up. In the rainy season, everything gets wet. The walls are also weak so she wants to buy tiles to strengthen the ceiling and cement for the walls.

By repairing her house, she will no longer have to worry that the beds will get wet or that water will get into the walls. She will be able to sleep in peace. Also while she's working, she won't worry or think about what is happening at home every time it rains.

Her goal is to keep working and continue repairing the house little by little until it is in good condition so her children feel comfortable there.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas and papayas, among others

loans.name: Kantutas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda comercial, venta de leche, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo heredo de sus padres hace varios años, ya que es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza, comercializará la leche en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Kantutas Blancas community bank is starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board where Rosa is the president.  The members' businesses are varied and include commercial stores, milk sales, and a bookstore.

Loans like this benefit small business owners like Rosa.  She says that she has done four loan cycles with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter of the institution that came to visit her at home.  Currently she has a business selling milk.  She inherited this business from her parents many years ago since it is a family business.

She is requesting this loan now for working capital to purchase a cow.  She will acquire it in neighboring towns and later raise it and sell the milk in her community.  The type of work allows her to generate income to support her household since she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su actividad que desempeña; este le servirá para comprar vacas paridas de repasto.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando en su negocio; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
José has chosen to request a new loan because he needs more operating capital so that he can continue investing in his business. This will enable him to buy two nursing cows for grazing.

The effect of his previous loan helped him to improve his income and continue working in his business. Both his financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy two nursing cows for grazing.

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Fiza is an energetic married lady. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and his income is insufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Fiza has been in the business of sewing for many years; she started her business to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques, and has retained regular customers. Due to increasing demands of her customers, she needs to buy a stock of thread with some packs of buttons, ribbons, laces and zippers in various colors. 

She has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of providing a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread with some packs of buttons, ribbons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE MERCEDES”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de camas, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de chicharron, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de fruta, venta de tenis.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace veinte años atrás al prender la técnica de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community association "Mercedes' little vicuñas" will initiate its seventh cycle with the organization Pro Mujer, as part of the Waterfall Focal Point project. The group is composed of 9 members and is led by a board of directors, with Martha serving as the president. The businesses belonging to the members of the community association are diverse and among them there are: braiding rugs, the sale of beds, the sale of rugs, the sale of sweaters, the sale of sausage, the sale of vicuña wool rugs, the sale of fruit, and the sale of tennis shoes. 

The requested loan will benefit these small microenterprises, including Martha's, who is a member. She told us that she joined Pro Mujer 5 years ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling rugs. She told us that she started this business over 20 years ago when she learned the skill of weaving.

The loan she is seeking today will be used to increase her capital (by buying  wool) through acquisitions from businesses primarily in the city of El Alto and later through the creation and sale of items for her salesroom. This type of work allows her to generate earnings to maintain her home as much as possible. In addition, she is married and has three children.
 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the trainings, the loans, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Maria still sells cosmetics and jewellery. Her previous loan worked out very well as she was able to buy low cost cosmetics wholesale. As a result, she gained customers and increased sales, and thus, also her net income. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale cosmetic products to continue increasing business profit. She is happy and grateful for the new opportunity this loan will provide.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 18 years old. She works in retail. She has a sari-sari store business, where she sells items like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. In addition, she has also had a fishing business for 30 years. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy gasoline, fish hooks, and a fishing net.

She hopes to expand her business and improve her profitability, so that she can better support her family in terms of food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish hooks and a fishing net.

loans.name: Mariano Mercedes

texts.es: Mariano vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 33 años de edad, él se dedica a la construcción de casas y en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para cuyes como pasto. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mariano, age 33, lives in the community of Mojopata. He builds houses for a living and, in his spare time, raises small animals such as guinea pigs. Mariano has been raising small animals for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts forth in his work. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Rising Sun of Mojopata).

Mariano is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy feed, such as fodder, for his guinea pigs. He is appreciative of and values this loan, so he promises to complete his monthly payments with a great deal of responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy feed for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 56-year-old married woman. She has successfully been running a small general store in the corner of her house, and she has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as she has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Zubaida is the mother of four children, and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packages of salt, biscuits, and beverages, in order to meet the growing demand from her customers. 

Zubaida is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 17 y 25 años. Ella, se dedica  a la venta de antojitos, oficio que lo realiza junto con su familia para salir adelante y lo desempeña todos los días, asimismo sale a vender a las diferentes colonias aledañas al municipio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar yuca, papas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos y fortalecer su negocio.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y asimismo construir su casa en un lote de terreno que posee.
texts.en:
Marta lives with her husband and their children, who are ages 17 and 25. She sells snacks and engages in this trade with her family so that they can get ahead. Marta works at her business every day and also sells in the different neighborhoods surrounding her town.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cassava, potatoes, and other supplies. This investment will help her to generate more income and strengthen her business. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family and to also build a house on a plot of land that she owns.

loans.use: to buy cassava, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has a business selling charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for nine years. She doesn't have any other income-generating activities, and she works from home seven days a week.

Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinder her movements. She aspires to buy a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to buy land and build rental rooms. She resides in her family home and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has seven children. She used her last loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Her husband is the one to go fishing and she will be the one to sell it in town for a living. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to buy fishing nets. Positively, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Zenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Zenelia tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera estudiante de la carrera de contaduría pública y finanzas, está trabajando como auxiliar contable en una empresa privada, con su salario se ayuda para los gastos de universidad, pero no le es suficiente como para pagar el curso de titulación, lo cual ya se acerca para finalizar su carrera. Para este fin  solicita el crédito para pagar este curso tan importante para el futuro de Zenelia, ya que con titulo en mano podrá tener la oportunidad de devengar un salario digno y justo.
texts.en:
Zenelia is 31 years old and single. She is studying for a degree in Public Accounting and Finance. Zenelia works as an assistant bookkeeper at a private business. Her salary helps with her university expenses, but it is not enough to pay for a course that is required for her degree, which she is close to completing. Therefore, Zenelia is requesting a loan to pay for this course since it is very important for her future.

With a degree in hand, she will have the opportunity to earn a decent and fair salary.

loans.use: to pay for a required course for her degree.

loans.name: Mercilinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercilinda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming sugarcane and rice graining. Mercilinda is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Mercilinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 41 years old and married.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs, noodles, snack foods, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

Alejandra has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years. She also earns additional income from buying and selling medicines and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs, noodles, snack foods, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a married mother blessed with four children, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Marian cooks food for sale at the market, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses as her major business challenge. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With this Kshs 15,000 loan she will purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda, age 45, is in the business of animal sales to support her family. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to meet the demands of her two children. For the improvement of her business she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Roque Iván

texts.es:
Roque es un hombre de 39 años de edad, esta acompañado y ha procreado dos hijos. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a desempeñarse como agricultor; de lo cual posee mucha experiencia fue un trabajo que aprendió de sus padres él antes estudiaba, vive junto a su compañera de vida e hijos.

Todos los insumos son comprados en una ciudad que esta a unos 15 kilómetros de su casa; pero también compra bovinos que es su fuerte, y es la actividad que más esfuerzo le demanda para adquirirlos; lo que significa que él se traslada hasta donde esta un ganado barato y bonito sea donde sea por lo que invierte bastante tiempo y dinero.
.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar de cuatro a cinco bovinos ya que tiene unos terrenos con mucho pasto y lo aprovechara para engordar los animales y en un futuro obtener ganancias con la venta de ellos. Con la compra de los bovinos podrá alimentarlos con el pasto de sus terrenos, ya que se están desperdiciando. También, podrá disponer de activos que en cualquier momento de apuro que pueda pasar echar mano de ellos y así no pasar por ningún problema grave.

Desea, seguir trabajando con la compra y venta de bovinos para que de alguna manera le generen ingresos para su familia y poder darles lo mejor con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Roque is 39 years old. He has a partner and two children. He has worked as a farmer throughout his life, and is therefore highly experienced. He learnt the trade from his father before he started his studies. He lives together with his life partner and children. 

All supplies are bought in the city which is situated 15 kilometres from his house. Although, he also buys and sells cows, which he considers his forte. They are also the most difficult to acquire: he has to travel to where good quality cattle can be bought cheaply, which often requires a large investment of his time and money. 

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo will buy four or five cows, as the land he owns currently has a rich pasture and he wishes to make the best of his fields to fatten his animals so in the future he can earn money selling them. By buying cows now, he can feed them on his rich pastures before they begin to spoil. He will also have spare credit, to avoid disaster should such an occasion arise.

He wishes to continue buying and selling cows in order to maintain his family and provide the best for them with the income earned.

loans.use: to buy four or five cows

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a single mother of four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. She has business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn't have any other income generating activity. 

Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation of bunches of green bananas from the villages to her stall at the market. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells at the market on wholesale only. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to get enough profits so as to build rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, medication and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Maredith

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maredith works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for it.

Maredith has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Three years ago Naseem, a 36-year-old married woman, started her general store business at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. This mother of two is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Naseem wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of grains, rice and flour to meet increasing customer demand. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, rice and flour.

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en: Alaga is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Alaga has requested a loan to buy pick axes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, fertilizer and a sack of unripe peanuts. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Alaga will spend her profits to help with her family's daily needs and also for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pick axes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, fertilizer and a sack of unripe peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compact discs and also lotions for women and men.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia has expertise in hand embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family for over 7 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with threads and beads.

Now she requested a loan worth 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more frames, needles, threads with some packs of pearls and stones in various colors to increase her sales. She is on her third loan with a good loan history. She wishes to maximize her profits from this business and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase more frames, needles, and threads with some packs of pearls and stones in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita, who is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is married and has four children. To make a living, Conchita has been running a general store for years, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community.

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase dried fish and bagoong. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old and married with twelve children. She works very hard to provide for them. Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and milk to sell. Francisca has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and milk to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 33-year-old married woman who lives near Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three school-going children. Shabana's family is poor and their living standard is inadequate.

Her husband owns a welding shop and it provides his only source of income. Her husband has to work very hard to feed his family.  Recently, the welding plant was shut down because of broken machinery and her husband has been unable to work and earn money.

Shabana humbly requests a loan of RS 45,000 from BRAC Pakistan. This will allow her husband to buy new welding tools and reopen his business. Shabana wants to establish a decent standard of living for her family. She will save some of the profit to meet such expenses in the future.

Shabana is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding tools

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia Asunta se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de maiz,la socia lo vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Asunta continues working on her business buying and selling corn. She sells corn in many different markets. She works from 8am to 6pm. She has worked on this business for 5 years and it is going very well. She dreams of having a place where she can sell her corn. She is seeking this loan to buy corn. She is content with the loans and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Fortaleza 5K Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA 5K”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de ovejas, venta de jugo de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chompas y mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo realiza hace tres años al aprender las técnicas de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Fortaleza 5k" (Strength 5K) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Rosa is the President. The businesses of the members of the bank are varied. Among them are selling sweets, weaving blankets, neighborhood store, selling potatoes, selling sheep, and selling quinoa juice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Rosa is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two cycles ago, joining at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution who came to visit her in her home. Now she has a weaving business and sells sweaters and blankets. She relates that she has had this business for three years after learning weaving techniques.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (by buying wool), which she will acquire from the fairs in the city of El Alto, and after making things she will sell them at the fairs. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings plan.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth manages her own store selling groceries in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is the proud mother of two and her husband is a fisherman. Fishing is their main source of income. She helps her husband by running the store for a living. In order to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and sachet products, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit which she joined in 2008. She hopes to improve their living conditions someday.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and sachet products.

loans.name: Mahjabeen

texts.en:
Mahjabeen is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and 5 children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and sells fresh vegetables door-to-door in the streets. He is very famous in town due to the freshness of his vegetables. Her husband is a very hard worker. He has to go to the vegetable market to purchase fresh vegetables early in the morning every day. A few days ago, her husband's cart collided with a car and the cart was damaged. Some vegetables were also smashed because of this accident. Now, her husband wants to repair the cart and align the wheels of the cart. He also wants to purchase vegetables such as lady fingers, lemons, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower and green chillies. Mahjabeen does not have her kith and kin in Lahore from whom to borrow some money. Mahjabeen has requested a loan of 28,000 PKR from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will spend a portion of this amount to repair the cart and the rest to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

Mahjabeen wants a proper vegetable shop for her husband, instead of a cart. Her dream to pass her life with peace and calm with her family. Mahjabeen is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as lady fingers, lemons, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower and green chillies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years. Analiza earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of NWTF loans. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vaipanoa

texts.en:
Vaipanoa is 51 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to start a small sewing business. In order to do so, Vaipanoa needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, thread, and cleaning oil. 

She hopes to use her profit to assist her family financially and save money for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, thread, and cleaning oil

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA MARIA Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres, la  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana tiene 54 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de El Torno,  es cliente nueva de la institución ya que es su primera secuencia, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Juana es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, también se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a su compañeras  de grupo.
texts.en: The entrepreneurial bank Santa Maria consists of eight members, all women. The president of the bank is Señora Juana, who is 54 years old. She makes and sells bread. Her bakery is located in the El Torno district. She is a new client of this institution, since this is her first loan cycle. Señora Juana is going to use this loan to buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour, lard, and leavening, wholesale. Señora Juana is a person with the will to achieve. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered her, since this is the only activity [she has] that allows her to support herself and her family. She also feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered to her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, lard, and leavening wholesale

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a  49 years-old lady. She has been running her business of hand embroidery for many years to contribute in the family's income. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her community and she makes enough to lead a decent life. 

Due to the increase in demand for her embroidery designs she is employing other women in her business to work for her. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and health care. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy stocks of threads, sequins and pearls in different colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy thread, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites operates her general store in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur where she lives with her family. Her husband is a rice farmer and she helps to earn an income by selling goods in the community. She has been running this business since she got married. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase oil, spices, canned goods and milk. She planned to expand her store in order to gain more profit for the bright future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, spices, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past many years, she has been successfully running a business of animal sales with the support of her husband. She has one cow and five goats. She looks after the cattle and her husband sells them to the people of their town and in the local market. She makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. This will help her to purchase two more goats. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mamao

texts.en:
Mamao is a 37 years-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Mamao has requested a loan to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, a rake, pickaxe, wheelbarrow and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Mamao will spend her profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, a rake, pickaxe, wheelbarrow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Nos lives in a small village in Reussey Keo district of Phnom Penh with her husband and children. Nos works to care for her family and keep her house well-prepared. The main source of income is generated by her husband who is involved in selling natural medicines in the surrounding areas and the nearby provinces. Her husband, Chea, strives hard in trading the medicine and uses a selling method he knows to achieve the maximum amount of profit as possible.

Her husband currently needs to buy more medicines to sustain his business. That’s why she has requested a loan amount of 1,200 US dollars to invest in the purchase of natural medicines, and thereby increase their sales. She is grateful for the support HKL and Kiva funds have provided her.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of natural medicines.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of one. She runs a food cafe in her village. She started the business from her personal savings that she had made. In the next five years she has a vision of turning the food cafe into a restaurant. She knew of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to open another cafe. She wants to use the income raised from the loan to build a house for herself and provide education for her child. The challenges she is facing include customers failing to pay in time and the price changes of food stuff.  These have impacted her business.

loans.use: to open another cafe.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, vive con su esposo de 49 años de edad y su suegra de 82 años de edad, todos trabajan y luchan cada día por su bienestar. Ella, posee una tienda y comedor, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días de 6:00am a 10:00pm, lo desempeña desde  hace 15 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar granos básicos tales como: frijol, maíz, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, golosinas, entre otros productos; esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio y obtener ganancias para su familia.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia donde vivir.
texts.en:
Rubidia lives with her 49-year-old spouse and her 82-year-old mother-in-law. They all work and struggle each day for their well-being. Rubidia owns a store and restaurant, an activity which she does from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. She has had it for 15 years.

The loan she is requesting would allow her to buy basic foods such as: beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and sweets, among other products. This will help her to maintain her business and earn profits for her family. 

Her dream is to have their own house to live in.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and candies.

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es: María Eloisa es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a confeccionar y hacer reparaciones de ropa, labor que realiza en compañía de su esposo durante largas jornadas diarias para cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes y, de esta manera obtiene los ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Conoció la actividad porque es una tradición familiar que ha tenido trascendencia en el tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea realizar el mantenimiento de las máquinas de coser y comprar un lote de telas, con el fin de tener más variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes y entregar un producto bien terminado; de esta forma espera incrementar sus ingresos. Su principal sueño es continuar con su negocio, mejorar el servicio y las ventas para poder seguir aportando al sostenimiento de su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Eloisa is a married woman and the mother of 2 children. Now she works in making and doing repairs on clothing, work that she does along with her husband during long work days to fill the orders of her customers. In this way she obtains the income to satisfy the basic needs of her household. She is familiar with this business because it is a family tradition that has had significance over time. With the loan that she is applying for with the corporation, she wants to do maintenance on the sewing machines and buy a batch of fabrics, with the goal of having more variety to offer her customers and delivering a well-finished product. In this way she hopes to increase her income. Her principal dream is to continue with her business and improve her service and sales to be able to continue contributing to the sustenance of her household and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on the sewing machinges and buy a batch of fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 40 años, sigue con la actividad de venta de DVDs en su tienda de venta cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un televisor para su negocio, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de DVDs, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria is 40 years old. She sells DVDs in her store. She says the last loan went well, and she used it to buy a television for her business. Mrs. Maria is going to invest this loan in buying DVDS, since there is a high demand right now. Mrs. Maria faces challenges in her business because of a lack of cash to buy her products. She is going to use the loan to continue buying a variety of products for each selling season. Her dream is to grow her business and help her family, since this is the way she supports her family.

loans.use: to buy DVDs

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de tortillas, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo, este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: maíz, leña y gas.
Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, gracias al crédito anterior, ya que le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias logro aportar a su familia con los gastos de la alimentación.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting another loan because she needs more money to continue investing in her tortilla business. This will allow her to buy necessary ingredients, such as corn, firewood, and gas. 

Juana's economic condition has improved, thanks to her previous loan, since it helped her to strengthen her business. With the earnings, she was able to support her family and take care of their nutritional needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and gas.

loans.name: Vaoiva

texts.en:
Vaoiva is 47 years old and married with two children. She plans to start a business selling general products for everyday use. She has requested a loan to buy a bag of sugar, flour, rice, a box of herring, a box of corned beef, and a box of chicken. 

Vaoiva will use her profits to buy more stock for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, flour, rice, a box of herring, a box of corned beef, and a box of chicken.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 34 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, and she helps operate their farm. She's been doing this business for more than eight years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,200 to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and buying manure for fertilizer.  

In the future, Erlina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and manure for fertilizer.

loans.name: Seipula

texts.en:
Seipula, 47, is a very kind and hard-working man. He lives with his wife and daughter. 

Seipula works very hard to grow cucumbers and tomatoes in his greenhouse during spring and summer seasons. His products are of very good quality and he sells them at different markets near his house. Besides growing vegetables himself, Seipula helps other farmers with various agricultural tasks. He works hard from the early morning until the late evening but his income is still not enough to support his family. 

In order to tackle his financial difficulties, Seipula is requesting credit from Credo to start a new business. Seipula will use the loan to purchase a big truck to start a transportation business. During his free time he will transport firewood from the forest and sell it to the locals.  

His loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides a business with start-up or re-start-up credit at reasonable conditions. The loans are given to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

Seipula is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the support will provide his family with more financial stability and allow him to save for home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to start a transportation service

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a fish-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase three sacks of fish, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for his business growth.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks fish, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan is a 47-year-old married lady. She is a motivated mother of five children and trying hard to provide them with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and an education. 

She does hand embroidery with her daughters, and her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue her operations, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors with some packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This would allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle, and has shown a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors with some packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kakiya, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments et de céréales.                                                 .                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe  Benkadi, sont à leurs dix huitième prêts solidaires.                                                                         
La cliente SADIO  qui est assise en troisième position à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des  colis de diverses sortes de condiments chez les grossistes dans les villages et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à Konobougou au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer un mouton, la gestion des problèmes familiaux et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are all married, and they average 37 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Kakiya, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in tubers, condiments, and grains. The women of the group Benkadi are on their 18th solidarity loan.

This client, SADIO, who is sitting third from the left in the photo, intends to purchase packages of various condiments from wholesalers in and around villages. She makes her sales, cash or credit, each day to men and women customers in Konobougou.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay for a sheep and to manage family problems. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena, 41, has a milk-selling business. She has been running her business with the support of her husband for the past fifteen years.  She is pictured with her husband.  

Rozeena and her husband have five cows. They sell milk to many of their neighbors. She looks after the cattle and milks the cows while her husband sells the milk at different markets. To generate extra revenue, Rozeena also uses the milk to make butter and cheese. The couple enjoy their business and are hoping to provide their five children with a secure future. 

Rozeena and her husband need to earn much more to meet their family's everyday expenditures, which include food, clothing, and education. In order to make more profit, Rozeena is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy another cow to increase milk production. She expects boost a boost in her earnings from increased sales.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years.  She has four buffaloes in milk, and she sells their milk, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk, to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of four and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

It’s Zarina’s fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support.  Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way, she will be able to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos, es una persona soltera y no vive con nadie. El, posee una tienda y molino, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, lo desempeña de 5:00am a 3:00pm y lo aprendió de su padre.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar un motor  eléctrico para su molino; esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la demanda de los clientes, ya que lo hará de una forma mas rápida y mejor el servicio.
Su sueño es adquirir un molino de tres tolvas y eléctrico.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single person and does not live with anyone. He has a store and a mill. He has had this business for three years. He works there from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm. He learned the business from his father.

The loan that he is applying for will allow him to buy an electric motor for his mill. This investment will help him to increase customer demand, since it will do it faster and improve service.

His dream is to acquire an electric mill with three hoppers.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor for his mill

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Furaha  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 23 ans et est mariée à  Eric, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 3 mois.
  
Elle fait le commerce de  matériels de plomberie (coudes, vannes, robinets,…) depuis  1 année et 6 mois. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  tuyaux  à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanine is part of the group Furaha and lives in Bujumbura. She is 23 years old and married to Eric, a merchant. Together they have one 3-year-old child.

Jeanine has been doing commerce in hardware (elbow joints, valves, faucets,… ) for a year and six months. 

She is on her third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many pipes or conduit to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase many hardware items to sell in order to  earn more

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar canastas, guacales de aluminio y una cocina de horno.
Las condiciones económicas han mejorado con el crédito anterior, ya que le ayudo a  aumentar los ingresos, asimismo las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Maribel is faced with the need to ask for a new loan because she requires more working capital to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to buy baskets, aluminium crates and an oven stove. 

Her economic conditions have improved with the previous loan, as it allowed her to increase her income, and her family's circumstances are also much better.

loans.use: to buy baskets, aluminium crates and an oven stove.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer,  se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo porque requiere seguir trabajando en su  actividad, por lo cual solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le servirá para comprar llaves y otras herramientas que le permitan surtir su  negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  a mejorar las condiciones económicas, ya que aumentaron sus ingresos, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Elmer needs more working capital because he needs to continue working in his business, and that is why he is applying for a new loan. This will serve him to buy keys and other hardware that will allow him to stock his business. 

The previous loan helped him improve his economic condition, since his income increased. The family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to buy keys and other tools

loans.name: Rositas De Hospital Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE HOSPITAL”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lindaura es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de CD’s, carpintería, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lindaura es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien le enseño a la elaboración de estos productos, posteriormente decide llevar sus productos a las ferias donde los vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el alimento de sus animales (compra de cebada) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente lo dará a sus animales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el ahorro.

En la fotografía no se encuentran dos señoras porque fueron a recoger su ganado de los campos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Rositas de Hospital” will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Copacabana. The group has ten members, and its board president is Lindaura. The communal bank members have various businesses: selling milk, selling CDs, carpentry, selling cheese, selling livestock, and selling wool.

This loan will benefit a micro business, of which Lindaura is a partner. She says this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, which she joined when an associate of the institution came to her house. Lindaura sells milk products. Her mother taught her how to make the products, and later she decided to sell her merchandise at fairs. She will use this loan to buy barley at local fairs to feed her livestock. Her work generates income to support her household; she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered that she liked the training and saving. Two of the group members do not appear in the photo because they were bringing their livestock back from the fields.

loans.use: to buy barley.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha tiene 50 años, casada, ella sigue con la misma actividad de  venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de villa Copacabana,  este préstamo es su  segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Bertha va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Bertha  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la  Sra. Bertha es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Bertha is 50 years old. She is married, and she continues with the same business of selling secondhand clothing from her sales stall, which is located in the Villa Copacaband zone. This loan is her second one within this institution. Señora Bertha is going to use this loan to purchase bundles of secondhand clothing for her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital. Señora Bertha faces challenges in her business, such as competition, since there are many people who work in this business in her zone. She is going to use the profits to continue improving her sales stall. Her wish for her business is to have it stocked with merchandise to offer a variety of products to her customers. Señora Bertha is a hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered, since this is the only activity [she has] that allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Sabari Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARCELINE représente le groupe SABARI KADI. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école.
Elle vend des habits depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02douzaines d’habits, 04pièces de pagnes et 03douzaines de tenues pour bébé.
Mme veut épargner ses économies. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité, mieuxs’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. MARCELINE represents the group SABARI KADI. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3. One goes to school.

Ms. MARCELINE has been selling clothing for two years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market. Her customers include both women and men.

She wants to purchase 2 dozen pieces of clothing, 4 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and 3 dozen baby outfits. She wants to save money. Her ambition is to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, 'pagne' cloth, and baby outfits to sell

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en: Tuloto is a 43 year old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Tuloto has requested a loan to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, fertilizer, rakes, pickaxe, chemicals and a wheelbarrow.She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Tuloto will spend her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, fertilizer, rakes, a pickaxe, chemical and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Las Faboritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FAVORITAS”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Romualda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, transporte de movilidades, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapa, venta de botones, venta de ropa, compra de material de construcción, venta de estuco.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Romualda es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace diez años atrás de una familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “LAS FAVORITAS” communal bank are starting their Eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group is made up of 6 members and is led by an executive board of which Señora Romualda is President. The businesses developed by the members are diverse and include: selling food, jumpers, weaving blankets, selling salchipapas (a kind of kebab), selling buttons, clothes, buying construction materials, selling plaster.

The loan they receive will benefit these small micro-businesses where Señora Romulada is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for 8 years, at the invitation of her friend who is part of the institution. Currently she has an artesanal business.  She says that she learnt her business 10 years ago from a relative.
 
The loan which they will now receive will increase the capital (buying wool) that the businesses in Cuidad de El Alto will acquire in bulk and later to produce what she will sell in her shop area. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can, as she is married and has a daughter.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training, the loans and the healthcare facilities.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace siete años trabaja en el comercio especialmente en la venta de carros, fue su hermano mayor quien le enseño el negocio. Antes era jornalero. Él se desplaza por toda la zona oriental en  busca de comercio o autos que de alguna manera le generen una ganancia.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para tener capital de trabajo para una oportunidad de negocio; ya que en el día a día se encuentra en un mercado de oportunidades; pero en esta ocasión el cliente lo invertirá en la compra de recipientes de cocina para venderlos y ja encontrado un proveedor que se los facilita a un buen precio y él asegura le genera ganancias.

Así mismo; podrá tener un nuevo negocio del cual espera sacar muchas ganancias y así cuando la venta de los carros este mal, él compensara con los ingresos de la venta de los recipientes de cocina. Por lo que, tendrá una fuente de ingreso extra que le generen ingresos para mantener a su familia y los gastos de la casa.

Los planes a futuro que tiene, es que sus hijos estudien y puedan ser profesionales ya que él no lo pudo ser quiere dejarles esa herencia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old. He is in a relationship and has three children. For the last 7 years he has been a businessman, particularly in car sales. It was his older brother who taught him the business. Before, he was a labourer. He travels all over the eastern area of the country looking for business or cars that will make a profit.
 
The loan he is asking for through Fundación Campo, will give him working capital for a business opportunity, as day-to-day there is a market of opportunities. But on this occasion Ricardo will invest in buying kitchen pans to sell and he has already found a provider who is offering them at a good price and a profit is assured.

Just like that, he will have a new business which Ricardo hopes will generate a large profit and so when car sales are down, he will compensate with the income from selling kitchen pans. As such, he will have an extra source of income which will help to look after his family and the household expenses. 

Ricardo's future plans include his children studying so that they can become professionals. As he couldn't do that himself, he wants to leave them this inheritance.

loans.use: to use working capital

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge, está soltero, vive con su familia, sus padres y un hermano, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres  desde la edad de 13 años y cuenta con una experiencia de 17 años, dicha actividad la realiza de 6:00am a 2:30pm, por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas; esta inversión le ayudara a darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo y obtener una mejor cosecha, uno de los riesgos seria la falta de lluvia.
Su sueño es crecer más en la agricultura y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, asimismo su objetivo es adquirir una pareja de terneros, al obtener la cosecha.
texts.en:
Jorge is single and lives with his family: his parents and a brother. He does not have relatives living abroad. He grows basic crops like corn and beans, a trade he learned from his parents at age 13. He has 17 of experience and works from 6:00 am until 2:30.pm without any problems. 

He will use the loan to buy needed farming supplies such as manure, herbicide, and insecticide. The investment will help him better maintain his crops and produce a good harvest. Lack of rain is one of the risks he faces. He dreams of being a better farmer and offering his family a higher standard of living. He also wants to buy a pair of calves after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is a 45 years-old married man. He is a father of six children; three sons and three daughters. All of them are under 18 years old. 

Hamdan works as an employee with a low wage and works in the car pieces trade. It is a profitable job but does not give Hamdan a stable income. Hamdan would like to improve his family's living conditions so he would like to work as a taxi drivers after his morning job. He would like to buy a new car  but he does not have enough capital. 

Hamdan took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of the new taxi he would like to purchase. This will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions. Hamdan appears in the photo besides his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the new taxi he would like to purchase.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Analyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine selling business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is an 18-year-old single young man from Tulkarm. He lives with his family in a small house.

Malek started his business one year ago and opened a barber shop in the neighborhood where he lives. It is a very profitable job and earns a good income, and he is well known in his village. 

Malek took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his barber shop by applying new decorations. This will make his shop more attractive to the customers and earn more income.

Malek appears in the photo in front of his barber shop.

loans.use: to improve his barber shop by applying new decorations

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
Paulino, se le presenta la necesidad  de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que él es electricista y necesita material de instalación de energía eléctrica; este le permitirá comprar cables, conexiones, cajas térmicas, suitt, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el servicio y aumentar su clientela, también los ingresos y esto los invierte en remodelar su vivienda; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
