texts.en: Paulino needs another loan. He is an electrician and needs installation materials. This loan will allow him to buy cables, connectors, thermal boxes, and more. With the previous loan, he was able to offer better service, get new customers, increase his earnings, and remodel his house. The economy has improved and, right now, he faces no problems.

loans.use: to buy cables, connectors, thermal boxes, and more.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia Dora pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” y este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de calca y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Dora continua con su negocio de compra y venta de oro, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

 La socia Dora solicita el préstamo para la compra de oro. 

La socia Dora agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank Clorinda Matto de Turner and this bank is located in the district of Calca in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Dora continues with her business of buying and selling gold. She has been in business for years which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

Dora is asking for a loan to buy gold. Dora appreciates and values the loan granted by this means and she likewise agrees to complete her payments according to the established plan.

loans.use: to buy gold to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys such as miniature cars and dolls.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Cristina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and additional livestock for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Cristina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Having no other source of income, Jeffrey decided to put up a small shoe repair shop in their village to generate income. He is 27 years old and still single. He aims to earn and save more income to help his parents in satisfying their necessities. He aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to increase his income.

Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy thread, needles and paint needed in repairing shoes and sandals. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business and is hoping that someday he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and paint needed in repairing shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs and groceries for her general store.

Anecita has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from the general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs and groceries for her general store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuff like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese valued at $100 and also eggs.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su mamá. Él es un joven visionario que posee muchas ganas y entusiasmo en ser mejor cada día, hace cinco años trabaja como albañil, trabajo que aprendió de un amigo que es albañil y lo había contratado de ayudante antes el se dedicaba a  estudiar.

Él compra los materiales en la ciudad a una distancia de 15 kilómetros de su casa; para trasladar los materiales tiene que pagar el transporte para el traslado del equipo que necesita para las construcciones.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillo, pago de mano de obra, para construir una habitación ya que recientemente se ha acompañado y dese tener privacidad en casa de su mamá.  Contar con un espacio más agradable para él y su compañera de vida  y brindar comodidad al pequeño que viene en camino.

Su puposito es, seguir trabajando fuerte y ahora al doble ya que tiene el compromiso de su esposa y de un hijo que esta por nacer y no quiere que les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 and lives with his life partner and his mother. He is a visionary young man, with the desire and enthusiasm to improve each day. For five years, he has worked as a bricklayer, a trade he learned from a friend who had employed him as as assistant before he began studying. 

He will buy supplies in a city about 15 kilometers from his house and will have to pay to have the necessary construction equipment delivered. He has a applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy sand, cement, and brick and to pay workers to build a room where he and his partner can have privacy within his mother's house. He and his partner will then have a nicer, more comfortable space for themselves and the child they are expecting.  

His goal is to keep working, and now doubly hard, since he has made a commitment to his wife and the child they are expecting and doesn't want them to lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and brick and to pay workers to build a room where he and his partner can have privacy within his mother's house.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La socia Grimaneza pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de jugos, la socia vende diferentes tipos de preparados de jugos para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fruta como platanos, papayas entre otros.

La socia Grimaneza en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo naranjas, plátanos, papayas y otras más.
texts.en:
Grimaneza belongs to the communal bank Clorinda Matto de Turner which is a part of the Asociación Araiwa.

She continues working selling juices, selling selling different types of juices prepared by request for various customers. Her business is doing well thanks to her daily efforts. She wants to be able to continue working like this in order to continue supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fruit such as bananas, papaya and others.

Grimaneza is taking this opportunity to access a loan in order to buy supplies such as oranges, bananas, papayas and more.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, papayas, and other fruit.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luegos los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha continues with her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens them and enables them to grow.  Then, she sells them at the different fairs.  She has had the business for seven years, and it is going very well for her.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell her animals.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
Beronica se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio, su esposo trabaja como chef profesional. Vive en casa propia junto con sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad El Alto.
 
El crédito es para comprar de una maquina freidora para pollo broaster Así podrá  aumentar su capital  y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Juana Berónica, es de tener pensión amplio de comidas

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Beronica sells food at her house.  Her husband works as a professional chef.  She lives in her own house with her four children in the city of El Alto.

The loan is to buy a frying machine to make broasted chicken.  This way she will be able to increase her capital and thus improve her quality of life.

Beronica’s dream is to have a meal service business with plenty of food.

This is the first time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a frying machine to cook chicken.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children and two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, rice and bread. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and bread

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bintiali has operated a clothes-selling business, in which she sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, Bintiali wants to purchase three bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 49 years old and married, with three children.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, laundry soap, and other groceries.

Daisy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Daisy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, laundry soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es:
Walter,  tiene 22 años de edad y está soltero, vive con su madre de 45 años de edad. El, se dedica a confeccionar hamacas, lo desempeña a tiempo completo, dicha actividad la aprendió con su madre y  cuenta con 8 años de realizarlo.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar  materia prima tales como: hilo de seda, agujas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la cantidad de unidades y obtener más ingresos.
Su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Walter is 22 years old and single.  He lives with his mother, age 45.  He makes hammocks, and he does this full time.  He learned this business activity with his mother, and he has been doing it for eight years.

The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy raw materials like silk thread and needles, among others.  This investment will help him to increase the quantity of units and to get more income.

His dream is for his business to be bigger and to improve the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like silk thread and needles, among others.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village near Jinen with her husband and four children; two sons and two daughters. All of them are under 10 years old. Sonia's husband is a worker with a very low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs so Sonia works as an employee to help her husband with part of the family expenses. Her work is far from where she lives. It is not easy for her to go everyday but she must work to help her husband. 

Sonia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy some necessary furniture especially living room chairs. This will improve the family's home conditions. Sonia would like to take another loan in the future to buy all the necessary furniture and home appliances needed.

Sonia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some necessary furniture especially for the living room

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Bernardita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Personal Collection and Avon products. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business selling used clothing.

Bernardita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecil is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Cecil has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a María, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar bolsos, collares, y relojes que le solicitaron sus clientes. Con esta inversión pudo invertir en más productos, con los cuales aumentó sus ingresos y utilidades, permitiéndole mejorar el surtido y atención a sus clientes, e igualmente esto se reflejó en su bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de bolsos, ya que este es el producto que más vende en su negocio. María dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por la ayuda brindada, y que siempre lo sigan haciendo”.
texts.en: Thanks to the support from her Kiva loan, she could buy bags, necklaces and watches which her customers requested. With this investment, she could invest in more products which increase her revenue and profits. This allows her to improve her selection and the attention given to her customers. It’s also reflected in her well-being. She is currently applying for a new loan to continue investing in the purchase of bags since this is the product that sells the most in her business. María says to her lenders: “Thank you for the help and may you always continue to do this”.

loans.use: continue to invest in the purchase of purses.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has one child in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Yanal

texts.en:
Yanal is a 22-year-old single man from Jenin city. Yanal's father works as a chef in a local restaurant in the city and gets a good income, but not enough to cover all the family’s needs. Yanal is still studying in the university and is in his last year, specializing in marketing. 

Yanal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Yanal will be able to complete his studies in the university and find a job to help his family. 

Yanal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 61-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 19 and 20. She and her husband are engaged in fishing to support their family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat. With this, she can be assured of continued business in fishing. Her income provides food and school fees for her family. 

In the future, Virginia hopes to be able to afford to send her children through college.

loans.use: to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors, but she faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children; two of them are school-going. 

She has been running a business of animal sales with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They buy animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, bring them up, and then sell them at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

Shameem has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and married; she has three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for six years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 29-year-old married lady. She has been actively involved in the business of cloth sales for four years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

So, she is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths of lawn and chiffon in different colors and designs. This will attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

Tahira expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths of lawn and chiffon in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 59 years old and married.

Clara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soap, detergent, canned goods, milk, soft drinks and other groceries.

Clara has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Clara aspires to save enough money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, detergent, canned goods, milk, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passers-by and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah, 36, is a married vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches stylish clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to complete the orders of her customers on time. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Al Malak Group

texts.en:
Faten is the featured borrower of Al Malak group. She got together with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is the one wearing grey at left.

Faten is a 46-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working by preparing and selling handmade souvenirs since four years ago. Faten is very talented in her domain and well-known in her region. She is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary handmade-souvenir needs such as threads, beads and many other new-release items. She will also use part of the loan to change her living room curtains to keep in a good situation since she expects most of her customers at home.

Faten is a hard worker; she also owns a small convenience store, which is necessary to have and manage well since it provides her family with a daily income.

As for the other borrowers, Ola is the one standing at the left wearing purple and Oussama is the one standing in the middle.

loans.use: to buy necessary handmade-souvenir needs such as threads, beads and many other new-release items.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very vegetative area located along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has three children. She has practiced farming for 16 years. Her main sources of income are:  bananas, coffee, maize, avocados, and beans. Besides farming, she has a green grocery business for an extra source of income.

She requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use it to purchase a chaff-cutter. This will enable her to prepare napier grass for her dairy cows to eat. This will enable the cows to produce more milk. Having more milk to sell will better her family's living standard. The challenge she faces is unreliable markets. In five years, she will have opened a milk bar. Rose says that Juhudi Kilimo has made her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
At the age of 51, Nusrat is successfully running a business of popcorn sales. She deliciously makes popcorn at home, and after packaging, she supplies the popcorn in the local market.  She has been doing this for many years and makes a good amount of income through her business.

To increase her supply, she needs to purchase another machine for popcorn making, with some packages of salt and unpopped corn. So she took her fourth loan, in the amount of Rs. 45,000, from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend the income on providing a better standard of living to her four children.

loans.use: to purchase another machine for popcorn making, with some packages of salt and unpopped corn

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell for her business.

Elena has been in this business for 10 years. Elena earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Imtyaz

texts.en: Imtyaz is a 48-year-old married woman and is running a milk sales business with her husband. She has two buffalos and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffalos and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They have been doing it happily together to support their family. To help her continue operations of her business, Imtyaz requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash to her. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. Imtyaz dreams of providing better standards of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her milk sales business

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Enriquita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Enriquita has been farming coconuts for 20 years and also earns additional income through food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
This is Juan, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Virginia, a meat vendor, and is the father to their one and only child. He and his wife are managing their household while operating the business. As the head of the family, he works hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Juan maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives in the late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profits. His regular customers are his neighbours and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 for his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his four tricycle units. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Juan dreams of having an additional source of income and hopes his child will finish his studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and married with four children. Nilda works very hard to provide for her family.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, coffee, canned goods, and snack foods. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past 10 years, selling to his town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during times of cold currents in the deep sea. 

Here he comes to you again, requesting a loan to purchase 12 bundles of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil and firewood. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve his business, and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bundles of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a natural medicine retail business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 14000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy food supplements and medicine to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplements and medicine to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 42-year-old married lady. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past nine years to meet the family expenses. Her husband is the only bread earner, and Kousar applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Kousar is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 49, is a married vigorous lady. She has three children; two of them are school-going. For the past many years, she has stitched clothes to support her entire family. She is well familiar with the techniques of stitching clothes according to fashion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes enough of an amount of money to spend a decent life through her business. 

In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy more reels of threads, with some packs of laces, buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. She is in her second loan cycle. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more reels of threads with some packs of laces, buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for specialized  business advice for starting his own business.

loans.name: Esmilcina Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia Esmilcina Yesenia tiene 41 años,es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de perfumeria,la socia socia vende perfumes para varones y mujeres,ella tiene una tienda en un centro comercial,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de perfumes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar perfumes para varones y mujeres.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en: Esmilcina Yesenia is forty-one, is married, and has two children.  She makes a living through her business selling fragrances.  She sells fragrances for men and women.  She has a store in a mall and works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has had this business for six years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fragrances.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fragrances for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is Richard. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar) unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Richard dreams of have more motorcycles and hopes to have his own house and lot. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycles.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a single parent of children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

In the Philippines, she has a buy and sell nipa business, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction businesses.  She also earns additional income from selling herbal medicines.  Lourdes is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buy and sell nipa business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities with her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business. Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. Marivic earns additional income from buying and sellling vegetables.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Briseyda Alexandra

texts.es:
Briseyda,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más mercadería para continuar en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa tales como: blusas, pantalones, ropa interior femenina.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus utilidades y fortaleció el negocio, las ganancias las utiliza para cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y el grupo familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
Briseyda finds herself in need of a new loan, as she requires more merchandise in order to continue her business. The loan would allow her to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, pants, and women's underwear.

Briseyda's previous loan helped her to increase her earnings and to strengthen the business. She uses the earnings to cover her basic living costs. Her financial situation has improved, and her family unit remains the same.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and women's underwear.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide all of the necessities of life for her family. That is why she is working with her husband, who is also shown in the photo with her. 

They have been running a small shop successfully for many years where they sell various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, chargers, etc. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has applied for her second loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. 

With the help of this loan, they can meet the increasing demands of their clients and generate more revenue. Shazia wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries.

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Madelin is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Madelin has been farming coconut for 18 years; she also earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jose, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo; este le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la productividad  de los granos básicos y sus ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar;  las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Jose has the need to take out a new loan because he requires more working capital.  He will use this loan to buy needed farming supplies like:  manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, etc.  His previous loan helped him increase his production of basic grains, and he will invest the profits in paying for his home's expenses.  His economic situation has improved and his family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
Higinio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque los créditos anteriores les ha proporcionado buenos resultados en cuanto a la producción del cultivo; este le servirá para comprar 6 quintales de abono,  insecticidas para limpiar las malezas de la milpa que ya tiene sembrado.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro una cosecha muy abundante y libre de plagas para comercializar o para el consumo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Higinio needs to take out another loan because the previous loans have brought good results for his crop production. This one will serve him to buy 6 quintales of fertilizer as well as insecticide to clear the corn he has planted. The previous loan really helped him, since he obtained an abundant crop free of pests to sell or consume. His family's financial conditions and circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintales of fertilizer as well as insecticide.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau was born in 1991. She lives in BacNinh - the smallest province in Vietnam. She is an environmental engineering major at the National University of Civil Engineering (http://nuce.edu.vn/). Her course lasts 60 months, and she will graduate in 2014. Her educational fees are subsidized by her parents. Chau plans to find a part-time job to pay for her educational fees. 

Chau’s family has six members. She is the first person in her family to graduate from high school and begin higher education. Her parents grow rice to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Chau has a passion for her major. She wants to complete this university course of study because she is very well-suited for this major, and it is developing in Vietnam. She understands that learning helps her to have qualifications to get a high-paid job, earn income for her family, and contribute to the community’s development. 

She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for her educational fees. Besides lacking funds for educational fees, she has other difficulties such as lacking the money to buy a computer to support her studies. She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has supported the education of many students in Vietnam.

loans.use: to pay fees for her education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, oil, and meat, among other things.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking mother of four children who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, and ribbons to meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle, and has a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, and ribbons.

loans.name: Alas

texts.en: Alas is a married, 48-year-old woman. She has devoted herself to providing a better standard of living for her family members by running a business of fabric sales. She purchases cloths in different colors and designs from the main city, and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She wants to expand her business, and needs to buy wide variety of fancy lawn and chiffon cloths in different colors and designs. But, due to low capital, she is unable to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 through Kashf foundation. In this way, she will be able to offer a wider variety of cloths to her customers for the upcoming event of Eid-ul-Fitar (a religious holiday in Muslim countries). She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of fancy cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: María Ventura

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años de edad, esta acompañada y ha procreado dos hijos. La señora se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde hace muchos años; ya que su familia siempre se ha dedicado a esas actividades y aprendió el trabajo ayudando a sus padres, nunca se ha dedicado a otras actividades.

La señora sale de su casa y camina unos 3 minutos a pie para llegar a la avenida donde aborda el autobús, que tarda unos 20 minutos para llegar al pueblo donde compra los productos para sus actividades.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para dar mantenimiento a sus potreros donde pasta el ganado, reparar cercos y sembrar pasto para alimentar al ganado en el verano, comprara semilla, abono, pesticidas y pagara jornales para cultivar el pasto. Al adquirir el crédito podrá mantener limpios sus pastizales, los cercos en buen estado y podrá cultivar suficiente pasto para la época seca. Para alimentar  a sus vacas, tiene la posibilidad de obtener mejores rendimientos en la producción de leche y carne y obtendrá de igual forma mejores ingresos para su familia  

Sus planes a futuro es construir un patrimonio para heredar a sus hijos para que tengan un principio para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been a farmer and a rancher for many years. Her family has always worked in these activities and she learned to work helping her parents. She has never done anything else. 

She leaves her house and walks 3 minutes to reach the avenue where she catches the bus which takes 20 minutes to arrive at the town where she buys the products for her activities.

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to do maintenance on her pastures where she grazes her cattle, as well as to repair fences and plant grass to feed her cattle in the summer and buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide and pay the laborers to plant the grass. By getting the loan, she will be able to keep her  pastures clean, the fences in good repair and grow enough grass for the dry season. By feeding her cows, she has the possibility of getting better results with milk production and obtain better income for her family.  

Her plans for the future are to build an inheritance for her children so they can have a good start and continue working.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her pastures where she grazes her cattle, repair fences and plant grass to feed her cattle in the summer, as well as buy seed, fertilizer,  pesticide, and pay the laborers to plant the grass.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and more for his business.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es casada y tiene 57 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los alimentos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de muebles, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.                                                                                                                                                                                              

The member's name is Andrea. She is 57, married and has 5 children. She works at her business raising animals, guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them up and then sells them at different markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and has had this business for 7 years. It is going well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and fed for the animals. The other members have businesses selling furniture, selling food, a convenience store and a restaurant. 

she is grateful to those who have been a part of her dream in the way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married with three children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000  PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Farah Group

texts.en:
Farah is a group composed of three Lebanese women living in a village in Mount Lebanon.  They decided to join hands and form the group in order to acquire a loan, from Al Majmoua, and in order to support each other financially.  Nouhad is the leader and featured member of the group.  She is a 41 year-old married mother of three children, sitting on the far left of the picture.  She is employed in a company which sells and trades beauty products.  However, she also owns her small business and sells beauty products, such as purses, bags, and other items.  Her husband also owns his personal business.  However, their combined revenue is not sufficient to provide a healthy life and environment for their household.  Furthermore, Nohad's children are enrolled in a private school, which adds tuition fees on top of the other family expenses.  She decided to establish the group in order to purchase beauty products and bags to enhance and expand her personal business.

As for the other group members, Diyaa is sitting in the center and Mona is sitting on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and bags to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old single man living in a small village in the South of Lebanon.  He owns a small business in the field of construction since six years ago, specialized in painting houses.  Enhancing his business at this stage is very crucial because it would allow him to gain a reputation in the future and increase his customers, thus his revenue.  Therefore, he contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a youth loan.  He will use this loan in order to purchase a new car from the ‘rapid’ category, which would help him transport his work kit from one construction field to the next.  As for the future, Hussein wishes to develop and expand his business in order to take charge of larger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and married with five children. For the past year she has been fattening up pigs to sell. She also is a food vendor to earn extra money.

Marivic is applying for a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She and her husband (shown in the photo) have been farmers for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Her husband assists her by watering the plants so as to get a good quality product.

In order to buy different types of seed, insecticides and pesticides, Shehnaz is applying for a loan of 20,000 PKR through Kashf. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will mean an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy different types of seed, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Perlita works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling herbal medicines in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from direct selling ready-to-wear.  Perlita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks of herbal products to sell to customers.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 47 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the seaweed-farming business for a long time now. The income that she generates helps in meeting the costs of food and household bills like electricity and water. Bebiana is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope. 

She hopes to continue doing business and be sustainable. She also dreamed of having other business someday.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Yanina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chicharrón de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yanina trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de campo como sembrado, riego, cosecha y otros, Yanina trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yanina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente ella prepara sus alimentos en una cocina a leña, la cual es peligrosa para su uso, de esta manera Yanina podrá preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos y tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en: Yanina is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her young son, whom she loves and who is her principal reason for living.  She is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to raising her son, as she is both father and mother to him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because she needed to start working at a young age, Yanina was unable to study to become a teacher as she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to watch movies, and sometimes cooks a delicious pork dish called "Chicharron de Chancho" to share with her family.  On her own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Yanina works as an agricultural laborer on a farm in her city.  Her work includes sowing, irrigating, harvesting and other farming tasks. Yanina works every day, starting early in the morning, and for appoximately 10 hours.  She likes her work and believes that she is doing well at it because of her good job performance and because of the friendly way in which she treats others.  Yanina is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to  buy a stove.  She currently prepares food on a wood-burning stove, which is dangerous for her to use.  Yanina will therefore be able to adequately prepare food and have greater security and well-being, so that she can continue working and trying to achieve her great dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Sarah Betty

texts.en:
Sarah Betty is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past seven years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells stationery. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more files, pens, reams of paper to sell. It will also help Betty to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees and their basic needs. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale stationery shop. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more files, pens, reams of paper to sell.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en: Monalisa is a  26-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business. She sells items like sugar, coffee, biscuits, shampoos, and other basic commodities. Monalisa requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy various goods like beverages, toiletries, and biscuits to avoid stock shortage and to provide a variety of goods to choose from. In the future, Monalisa  would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various goods like beverages, toiletries, and biscuits.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 26-year-old married man living in a small village in the South of Lebanon. He owns a small business where he is in charge of car maintenance, and he specializes in body work. His wife is currently unemployed; therefore he is the only financial provider of the household. Thus, maximizing his revenue would allow him to truly establish a family and to provide care for potential children. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a YOUTH loan in order to purchase specialized machines for pulling and compressing car bodies to fix them after accidents. In the future, he would like to purchase an oven for the painting of cars.

loans.use: to purchase specialized machines for pulling and compressing car bodies.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is married and has four children, all in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Jhenuz Group

texts.en:
Jhenuz is a group composed of three Filipino women working as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to establish the group and acquire a loan from Al Majmoua because each of them is in dire need of financial support. Jennifer is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 31-year-old single mother of two children, sitting on the far right of the picture. Her children live back in the Philippines, and she is their only financial provider. In fact, she decided to form the group and acquire a loan in order to pay the tuition fees of her children who are both enrolled in private schools. Her low-income job could not allow her to provide for her own self and for her children as well.

As for the other group members, Jocelyn is sitting in the center of the picture, while Airies is sitting on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of her children who are both enrolled in private schools.

loans.name: Sreynhanh's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40 years, Sreynhanh lives in a rural area located in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is a widowed mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living by selling snacks in her village. She makes about 25,000 KHR a day which she uses to meet the family’s needs.

This is the seventh loan for Sreynhanh with VisionFund. She is leading her group of seven members in applying for a 1,225,000 KHR loan. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine, which will include a toilet bowl, drainage tiles, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Sinoern's Group

texts.en:
Sinoern is 55 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district earning a living through selling snacks and rice in her villages. Having been in this business for 20 years, she can earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sinoern has been with VisionFund for six cycles and fully paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sinoern will use her portion to buy materials to construct a latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her and her family to have a decent latrine.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a latrine

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: Diana Marcela es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a terminar sus estudios de psicología, actividad que alterna con la atención de su distribuidora de arepas, producto que ofrece tienda a tienda en el área urbana del municipio, con gran esfuerzo ha obtenido ingresos para costear sus estudios y aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar. Diana es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada y con el préstamo que solicita desea pagar una asesoría especializada en la Corporación, sobre creación de empresas ya que desea montar una IPS donde pueda ejercer su carrera. Su principal sueño es poder realizarse profesionalmente, posicionarse y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Diana Marcela, 27, is single and doesn't have any children yet. Right now she is dedicated to finishing her degree in psychology, while also selling arepas store to store in her town. With hard work she has made enough money to cover her education costs and contribute to her household expenses. She is dedicated and tenacious and with the requested loan she wants to pay a corporate advisor in business creation because she would like to start a business with her new career. Her biggest dream is to be able to practice her profession, and put herself in a position to generate more income that will allow her to improve her wellbeing and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a corporate advisor to help with business creation.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a worker abroad, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses.

Ramona has a dishwashing liquid business. She buys the ingredients and mixes them to make a dishwashing liquid. She puts the liquid into bottles, and then sells and distributes them to some variety stores. She also sells them to her neighbors and in the local community. She earns a minimum of 6,000 PHP in sales weekly.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bottles and ingredients for making dishwashing liquid.

Ramona dreams of expanding her business, and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed for making dishwashing liquid for her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 32 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 7-14. Annabelle raises her children through her income growing corn. She also makes charcoal for additional income. A motorbike is used to transport their produce. 

She works hard so she can provide for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees, motor repair, and registration.

Education is important to her, and she will spend her income on her children's schooling. In the future, she hopes to see her children be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, motor repair, and registration.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 
Iman is a 24-year-old married woman from Beit Hanoun near Jabalia. She lives in a humble house with her husband and three young children; two boys and one daughter. Iman's husband works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs and necessary expenses. Iman's husband works also on a taxi in the evening so he will have another source of income. 
Iman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Iman's husband to do the yearly maintenance for his taxi. This will help him with part of the urgent expenses he has. This will allow him to work extra hours especially in the area where he lives which is very crowded.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Tezzy

texts.es:
Tezzy es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una  persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar  a sus padres, Tezzy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar unos riquísimos Juanes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Tezzy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas y bocaditos en general, ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días para preparar alfajores, rosquitas, tequeños, pasteles y demás bocaditos que sus clientes le solicitan, Tezzy puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas, atendiendo a un promedio de 20 clientes y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Tezzy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de insumos, como sacos de harina, azúcar, dulces, pasas, materiales de pastelería y otros, de esta manera Tezzy podrá seguir realizando sus trabajos de manera adecuada, así pues ella seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Tezzy is a thirty-two-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and 2 children, whom she loves and who are her principal reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person.  She and her husband devote all of their efforts to raising their family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because she had to start working at a young age to help her parents, Tezzy was not able to study business administration as she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to cook delicious Peruvian rice dishes called "juanes" to share with her family.  On her own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Tezzy works in her own small business selling cakes and a variety of snacks.  She gets up very early every day to make cookies, appetizers, cakes and other snacks that her customers request.  Tezzy works approximately 12 hours per day, serving about 20 customers. She believes that her business is doing well because of her tasty products and because of the friendly way that she treats others.  Tezzy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of ingredients, such as bags of flour, sugar, sweets, raisins, cake-making materials and other things.  With this, Tezzy can continue working in order to achieve her great dream, which is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for a cake shop.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking man who does his best to meet the target needs of his family. He has operated a laundry business, and his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He dreams of purchasing a washing machine for greater efficiency and of expanding the business.

Once again, he comes to you asking for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a washing machine for the business. He decided to join Yehu because of its favorable lending procedures, and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for the business.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim is a villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district. She is 46 years old and is married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for several years, Sarim can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Sarim’s group of four members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarim wants to use her portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes to have a latrine for her family's use to increase their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo, 43, is widowed. She lives in a rural area of Kandal province's Ponhea Leur district, Cambodia. Rice- and snack-selling have been her main sources of income for 10 years. The current business earns her approximately 25,000  KHR per day to meet her family's needs.
 
Sambo's group, for which she is the leader, consists of six members who live in the same village. She is a first time borrower with VisionFund. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine such as latrine bowl, tile draining etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a widowed woman with three children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Friends Group

texts.en:
Friends is a group composed of three Filipino ladies who have been friends since they arrived to Beirut. They decided to join hands and support each other financially for business purposes. 

Lorna is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, standing on the far left of the picture. She owns a small business where she sells and trades purses on the network of "Whatsapp." Her husband is Lebanese and is currently unemployed. She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise (bags, shoes, etc.) to enhance her business. She is planning to open her own shop in the future, but at this time, she can’t afford such financial expenses. 

As for the other group members, Gretchen is standing at the center of the picture, while Arlene is standing on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (bags, shoes, etc.) to enhance her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Chanthy is a 23-year-old mother of one son. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on 5 hectares of farmland, which she has been doing for one year. With her current business, she can earn about 51,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to spend for daily expenses.
 
This is the third loan for Chanthy with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Agricultores De Chuisajcab 1 Group

texts.es:
Francisco es el representante del Grupo de Agricultores Chuisajcab 1  (de camisa verde el primero del  lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es un  hombre  soltero de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el Caserío Chuicascab, Aldea Tzucubal  Nahualá. 
El  es un hombre trabajador y amable, comenta que el se dedica a la siembra de maíz  a unos metro de su vivienda, eligió este tipo de actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron esta labor.
Ahora gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo puede alimentar a su familia y lo puede comercializar en el mercado local. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que lo ayudan a contribuir  con la economía familiar.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran una parte de este crédito para la siembra  de maíz, con el  propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para poder construir su vivienda y así darle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is the representative for the “Grupo do Agricultores Chuisajcab 1” (wearing a green shirt, the first from the left in the photograph). He is single, 54 years old, and lives with his daughter in the small town of Chuicascab, in the Tzucubal Nahualá aldea. 

He is a hardworking and friendly person. He explains that he plants corn a few meters from his house. He chose this type of business because his parents taught it to him.

Now, thanks to his hard work, he can feed his family and he also sells in the local market. Through his work he earns good income and earnings, which helps him to contribute to the family budget.
